sub_topic: Solving systems of linear equations using QR decomposition
message_1:
Consider the system of linear equations:

x + y + z = 6

2x - y + 3z = 4

3x - 2y + z = 2

Using QR decomposition, solve the system of linear equations above.
message_2:
To solve the system of linear equations using QR decomposition, we first need to represent the system in the matrix form Ax = b, where A is the matrix of coefficients, x is the column vector of variables, and b is the column vector of constants.

A = | 1  1  1 |      x = | x |      b = | 6 |
    | 2 -1  3 |          | y |          | 4 |
    | 3 -2  1 |          | z |          | 2 |

Next, we perform QR decomposition on matrix A, which decomposes A into an orthogonal matrix Q and an upper triangular matrix R.

Using the Gram-Schmidt process, we can find the orthonormal basis for the column space of A:

u1 = (1, 2, 3)
v1 = u1 / ||u1|| = (1/sqrt(14), 2/sqrt(14), 3/sqrt(14))

u2 = (1, -1, -2) - proj_v1(1, -1, -2) = (1, -1, -2) - (1/7)(1, 2, 3) = (6/7, -9/7, -11/7)
v2 = u2 / ||u2|| = (6/7, -9/7, -11/7) / sqrt((6/7)^2 + (-9/7)^2 + (-11/7)^2) = (6/7, -9/7, -11/7) / sqrt(218/49) = (6/sqrt(218), -9/sqrt(218), -11/sqrt(218))

u3 = (1, 3, 1) - proj_v1(1, 3, 1) - proj_v2(1, 3, 1) = (1, 3, 1) - (1/7)(1, 2, 3) - (6/218)(6, -9, -11) = (1/7, 15/7, 3/7)
v3 = u3 / ||u3|| = (1/7, 15/7, 3/7) / sqrt((1/7)^2 + (15/7)^2 + (3/7)^2) = (1/7, 15/7, 3/7) / sqrt(235/49) = (1/sqrt(235), 15/sqrt(235), 3/sqrt(235))

Now we can form the Q and R matrices:

Q = | 1/sqrt(14)   6/sqrt(218)   1/sqrt(235)  |
    | 2/sqrt(14)  -9/sqrt(218)  15/sqrt(235)  |
    | 3/sqrt(14) -11/sqrt(218)   3/sqrt(235)  |

R = | sqrt(14)  1/sqrt(14)  1/sqrt(14)  |
    |    0     sqrt(218)  -6/sqrt(218) |
    |    0        0       sqrt(235)    |

Now we can solve the system Rx = Q^Tb:

Q^Tb = | 1/sqrt(14)   2/sqrt(14)   3/sqrt(14)  | | 6 | = | 6*sqrt(14)/7 |
       | 6/sqrt(218) -9/sqrt(218) -11/sqrt(218)| | 4 |   |  2*sqrt(218)/7|
       | 1/sqrt(235)  15/sqrt(235)  3/sqrt(235) | | 2 |   |  4*sqrt(235)/7|

Now we can solve the system using back-substitution:

z = (4*sqrt(235)/7) / sqrt(235) = 4/7

y = (2*sqrt(218)/7 + 6*z/sqrt(218)) / sqrt(218) = (2*sqrt(218)/7 + 6*(4/7)/sqrt(218)) / sqrt(218) = 1

x = (6*sqrt(14)/7 - 1/sqrt(14) - 1/sqrt(14)) / sqrt(14) = (6*sqrt(14)/7 - 2/sqrt(14)) / sqrt(14) = 1

So the solution to the system of linear equations is x = 1, y = 1, and z = 4/7.
